Software.Title: Budgeter (Budgeting Web Application)
Software.Description:
• An application I built modelling what I was doing mannualy on Excel, mostly to track expenses and sales, but also a page to help with my side hobby of buidling PCs

• Used a combination of React for the front-end and Python/Flask with SQLite for the back-end

• Worked on a Linux based cloud server using Nginx to deploy applications

Software.Title: American Sign Language Detection
Software.Description:
• An application that is used to train a model to be able to predict American sign language characters, also has the ability to detect the signs from pictures users can take from their own device

• Used PyTorch to implement three neural networks and also created a wrapper to train and predict the signs

• Worked in an agile manner with a group, making use of kanban and weekly standups

• Built an interactive UI using PyQt

Frimware & Digital.Title: Wireless Baby Weighing Scale
Frimware & Digital.Description:
• Created, in a team of 7, a wireless scale from the ground up, including hardware for weight measurement and a user-interactive app

• Developed firmware for an ARM-based Raspberry Pi Pico, utilising peripherals such as ADC, Timer, UART, and I2C

• Firmware programmed using C and CMake, the scale was configured to use HTTPS to communicate with our backend

• Deployed our team's software backend using AWS Elastic Beanstalk and managed the server setup, including TLS configuration, through AWS EC2

Frimware & Digital.Title: Line Following Robot
Frimware & Digital.Description:
• Line following, maze completing robot which computes the shortest path in the maze when given points it must visit, Firmware implemented on an Arm Cortex M3 PSoC

• Created light sensing circuitry and then designed the corresponding PCB using Altium designer

• Designed shortest path algorithms for the robot to follow and made use of them through the firmware

• Interfaced the motors with components such as PWM generators and quadrature encoders/decoders.
